intro: Phlegmariurus gunturensis, commonly known as the Guntur clubmoss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy shoots and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its dense, clustered growth habit and dark green foliage. It plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is often associated with humid tropical and subtropical regions.
